name: Math.max(n1, n2, ..., nX)
content: Some apps need to know the maximum number from a collection of numbers or variables. You can call *Math.max* with zero, one or more parameters, depending on how many numbers you want to compare.

examples.name: Example: Typical Usage
Example: Using more than two values

palette_params.name: n1, n2,..., nX
palette_params.description: One or more numbers or variables to compare.

return_value: A number representing the highest of the values given as parameters, or -Infinity if no arguments are given, or NaN if one or more arguments are not numbers.
short_description: Returns the maximum value among one or more values n1, n2, ..., nX.
